title: I Can't Go to Work Tomorrow! Work-Family Policies, Well-Being and Absenteeism. (arXiv:2401.13678v1 [econ.GN])
abstract: Among the main causes of absenteeism are health problems, emotional problems, and inadequate work-family policies (WFP). This paper analyses the impact of the existence and accessibility of WFP on work absenteeism, by considering the mediating role of the well-being, which includes emotional as well as physical or health problems, that is generated by these policies. We differentiate between the existence of the WFP and its accessibility, as the mere existence of the WFP in an organisation is not enough. Additionally, workers must be able to access these policies easily and without retaliation of any kind. The model includes the hierarchy and the gender as moderating variables. To test the proposed hypotheses, a structural equation model based on the partial least squares structural equation modelling (PLS-SEM) approach is applied to a sample of employees in the service sector in Spain. On the one hand, the findings show that the existence of WFP has no direct effect on absenteeism; ho

translated_title: 我明天不能去上班了！工作家庭政策、幸福感和旷工问题
translated_abstract: 旷工的主要原因包括健康问题、情绪问题和不完善的工作家庭政策（WFP）。本文分析了WFP的存在和可及性对旷工问题的影响，考虑到由这些政策引发的幸福感在其中的中介作用。我们区分了WFP的存在和可及性，在组织中仅仅存在WFP是不够的。此外，员工必须能够轻松地访问这些政策，而且不受任何形式的打击。模型还包括等级制度和性别作为调节变量。为了检验所提出的假设，本文运用基于偏最小二乘结构方程模型（PLS-SEM）方法的结构方程模型，对西班牙服务业员工样本进行分析。一方面，研究结果显示WFP的存在对旷工问题没有直接影响；
tldr: 本研究旨在分析工作家庭政策的存在和可及性对员工旷工问题的影响，考虑到幸福感在其中的中介作用。研究发现，工作家庭政策的存在本身对旷工问题没有直接影响；
en_tdlr: This study analyzes the impact of the existence and accessibility of work-family policies on absenteeism, considering the mediating role of well-being. The findings suggest that the mere existence of work-family policies does not directly affect absenteeism.
